meanings.definition: A tendency to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen.
meanings.sent1: Her constant pessimism made it hard for her to enjoy anything.
meanings.sent2: His pessimism about the outcome of the game was evident in his tone.
meanings.sent3: Despite his friends' efforts to cheer him up, his pessimism remained unshaken.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of optimism, pessimism lurked like a shadow.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of pessimism loomed over the horizon of his thoughts.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that this world is as bad as it could be.
meanings.sent1: The preacher's pessimism about human nature was reflected in his sermons.
meanings.sent2: Some people find comfort in the idea of pessimism, believing it prepares them for the worst.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the extreme pessimism of his neighbor, who always expected the worst.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of pessimism, every silver lining has a cloud.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted a world consumed by the flames of pessimism.
